events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses following recent surgery and treatment costs.
Loan application was categorised under personal loans due to mention of medical expenses as the primary funding purpose.
A loan officer was assigned promptly to assist the applicant throughout the personal loan process.
Initial review of the loan application indicates the applicant’s credit profile meets the minimum personal loan criteria.
The loan officer requested further documentation including medical bills and proof of income to support the loan application.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including detailed medical invoices and recent pay slips.
Credit check was completed successfully showing no outstanding debts or delinquent accounts.
Risk assessment concluded the applicant has moderate risk due to recent medical leave but stable monthly income.
A personal loan offer with favorable interest rates and flexible repayment terms was presented to the applicant.
The applicant provided positive feedback, expressing satisfaction with the offer and terms presented.
Application was escalated to the senior loan committee for approval given the loan amount requested exceeded standard limits.
The senior loan committee approved the personal loan application after reviewing the risk analysis and supporting documents.
The approved loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant’s designated bank account.
Follow-up contact made to confirm receipt of funds and to answer any questions regarding repayment schedule.
The loan application case was formally closed after confirming all post-funding procedures were completed satisfactorily.
